pageContext.claim: “Certainly, [Sweden has] a problem with the immigration.  It’s caused problems in Sweden.  I was one of the first ones to say it.  I took a little heat, but that was okay because I proved to be right.”
pageContext.analysis: Crime rates in Sweden are rising and the country has accepted a large number of migrants over the last several years. But the link between them isn't as clear as Trump makes it seem. A New York Times report notes police attribute the violence to a failure to integrate gangs. The Times reported, "A recent study of a Swedish street gang that found 24 percent of its members were ethnic Swedes, and 42 percent had been born in Sweden."
